mn53:2.1: The completion of a town was celebrated by a talk for the Sakyans at [sn35.243:1.2]() and the Mallas at [dn33:1.2.1](). Such halls were community meeting places that played a central role in civic society and communal decision-making in democratic republics such as the Mallas and the Sakyans. The Buddha’s participation is a sign of his support for their civic and democratic process.

mn53:16.1: The root sense of “mindfulness” (_sati_) is “memory”. It can be understood as the element of continuity in the mind, knitting consciousness together. Thus when practicing “mindfulness of breathing” one pays continuous attention to the breaths, not “forgetting” what one is doing.
